roleset.name: location, put in a location
roleset.note: PLACE-V NOTES: Ignore the frequent adjectival usages like "privately placed orders". (from place.01-v)
PLACEMENT-N NOTES: Based on sentences in wsj. Comparison to place.01. See Vn class put-9.1-2. See Fn class placing. Framed by Katie. (from placement.01-n)

example.name: basic 'put' sense
example.text: ...the possibility that [Sea Containers' subsidiaries]-1 might be required *trace*-1 to place their shares in the open market.

example.name: with misplaced modifier (more common than you'd expect)
example.text: Policies designed to encourage one type of investor over another are akin to [*] placing a sign over the Big Board's door saying: ``Buyers welcome, sellers please go away!''
example.arg: saying : `` Buyers welcome , sellers please go away

example.name: place an order (with adjuncts)
example.text: Dealers placed heavy buy orders in the morning to start the first trading day for November transactions .
example.arg: to start the first trading day for November transactions

example.name: Arg 2 only
example.text: The placement through Gray Seifert Securities New York to institutional investors.
example.arg: through Gray Seifert Securities New York
